Docs.summary: Manages the user interface (UI) for a smart tag panel. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can control the display of your designer's <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.ActionLists%2A> with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService> class. <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService> provides a straightforward interface for displaying the items for each component, including the following methods and events:
- The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.ShowUI%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.HideUI%2A> methods display and hide the items for a component.
- The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.DesignerActionUIStateChange> event indicates when the UI changes for a component.
Use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionService> to manage the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> collections associated with your component.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.Refresh%2A> method to update a smart tag panel. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionService> class overview.

## Remarks Call <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService>. The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService> in an unusable state. After calling <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService> was occupying. For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService>. Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService> object's `Finalize` method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the smart tag panel is currently being displayed, the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.HideUI%2A> method will hide it. This method raises the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.DesignerActionUIStateChange> event, stipulating <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIStateChangeType.Hide> as the event type.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.HideUI%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionUIService.ShowUI%2A> methods are implemented only to raise their corresponding events. The actual functionality is found in the handlers for these events, which are part of the design-time environment.
